subject: Communication
title: Gift-Giving Etiquette: A Minefield of Meaning
description: Learn Gift-Giving Etiquette: A Minefield of Meaning in one minute.

hook.text: Give a clock in China and you've wished them death. Give white flowers in Japan and you've brought funeral vibes.

buildup.text: Gift-giving rules vary wildly: open gifts immediately (US), never open in front of the giver (Japan), always give with.

discovery.text: In some cultures, gifts build relationships. In others, they create obligations. In some, they're expected.

twist.text: The value matters too. Too expensive in Scandinavia is uncomfortable. Too cheap in the Middle East is insulting.

climax.text: Successful cross-cultural gift-giving requires research, not instinct. Your defaults are culturally loaded.

punchline.text: A gift doesn't say what you intended. It says what their culture interprets.

quiz.question: Why should you avoid giving clocks as gifts in China?
